text: Gardenia storckii is a species of plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is endemic to Fiji. The native gardenias of Fiji possess a diverse array of natural products. Methoxylated and oxygenated flavonols and triterpenes accumulate on the vegetative- and floral-buds as droplets of secreted resin. Phytochemical studies of these bud exudates have been published, including a population- level study of two other rare, sympatric species on Vanua Levu Island in the Fiji archipelago, G. candida and G. grievei Miller, J. M. and S. Sotheeswaran. 1993. Bud exudate composition and ecogeography of Fijian Gardenia species (Rubiaceae). Biotropica 25(1): 117-122. ==References== Category:Endemic flora of Fiji storckii Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Taxa named by Daniel Oliver
title: Gardenia storckii
